other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is slightly distended measuring 4 cm with a 4-mm thickened wall and a sliver of pericholecystic fluid. A shadowing gallstone is seen in the gallbladder neck. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation with common bile duct measuring 4 mm. The liver is normal without focal lesions. The portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. No upper quadrant ascites.
